data.text:
"Oh, so that's why Police Academy (2024 film) is so small!" â€” Emily Elephant, "High Price of Neighboring" This article is a stub. You can help the JH Movie Collection Wiki by expanding it.

Police Academy is an upcoming 2024 American-Canadian adult computer-animated comedy film directed by James Bobin from a screenplay by Robert Zemeckis and a story by Nicholas Stoller. Produced by the Warner Animation Group, Village Roadshow Pictures, ImageMovers, RK Films, Vertigo Entertainment, and Lord Miller Productions and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures, the film serves as a reboot of the original 1984 film of the same name. Its story follows a new recruitment policy for an unnamed police department's academy that is required to take in any recruit who wishes to try out to be a police officer.

Plot[]

Coming soon!

Cast[]

Colin Hanks as Carey Mahoney, an easygoing, trouble-making, womanizing, lovable rogue with a heart of gold who has to enroll in the police academy to avoid a prison sentence and is the most normal and sane among his classmates while always standing up to arrogant people. He's the main protagonist of the film.

Jamie Foxx as Larvell Jones, Mahoney's partner and best friend. Larvell is a skilled martial artist, but his main talent is beat-boxing. He's best known for making sound effects with his voice.

Chris Pratt as Eugene Tackleberry, a gun-obsessed adrenaline junkie who packs a revolver with serious stopping power.

Kevin Michael Richardson as Moses Hightower, a gentle giant and florist.

Willow Smith as Laverne Hooks, a shy girl who can be loud when unexpected.

Bill Hader as Douglas Fackler, a bespectacled, mild-mannered, and accident-prone man who always makes a mess without knowing it.

Seth Rogen as Leslie Barbara, an overweight cowardly man.

Antonio Banderas as George Martin, a ladies man who puts on a fake Hispanic accent.

Kristen Wiig as Sergeant Debbie Callahan, a stoic, no-nonsense buxom instructor who is both physically and sexually aggressive.

Liev Schreiber as Lieutenant Thaddeus Harris, an ambitious instructor who is the film's main antagonist.

J. K. Simmons as Commandant Eric Lassard, the commandant of the police academy who becomes a father figure to the cadets.

Production[]

Development[]

The animation production were handled by Sony Pictures Imageworks, while Skywalker Sound handled the post-production sound services.
